messages.subject: teaching with movies and Mel Gibson as "Tim"
messages.msgSnippet: ... Karen Thank you for sharing this site with us. I just quickly browsed through it and I know I will be using it a lot. My children are always on the look
messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@y..., "Karen" <kbmatlock@a...> wrote:
> From www.teachwithmovies.org: (Recommended ages are in parentheses)

Karen

Thank you for sharing this site with us. I just quickly browsed
through it and I know I will be using it a lot. My children are
always on the look out for movies about the things they are
interested in.

---------------------------------------------------------------------
I have never seen the movie "Tim", but I read the book a long time
ago. I didn't want to see the movie since I enjoyed the book so much.
I didn't want to ruin it. Now that I know that Mel Gibson was in it,
I think I'll mosey on over to our library's website and see the movie
is there.

Kathy

messages.messageBody:
This is a great movie. I saw it years ago and then when I saw him
advertised to play in another movie I raced to see it as well.
Unfortunately the movie was Mad Max -- not quite what I'd hoped for:)

messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Revolutionary war
messages.msgSnippet: From www.teachwithmovies.org: (Recommended ages are in parentheses) The Colonial Period Ben & Me (U. S./Colonial Period & Pennsylvania; Science-Technology;
messages.messageBody:
From www.teachwithmovies.org: (Recommended ages are in parentheses)

The Colonial Period
Ben & Me (U. S./Colonial Period & Pennsylvania; Science-Technology;
Biography; Char. Dev.: Male Role Model; Ethical Emphasis: Responsibility and
Citizenship) [6-9]
The Crucible (Drama; U.S./Colonial Period, 1945-1991 & Massachusetts; Char.
Dev.: Justice; Marriage; Ethical Emphasis: Trustworthiness and Fairness)
(Two versions, one in French with English Subtitles) [12+]
The Mayflower Voyagers [7 - 11]
Roots Vol. I (U.S./Diversity; Char. Dev.: Diversity) [12+]
Roots Vol. II (U.S./Diversity; Char. Dev.: Diversity) [12+]

1750 - 1812: Creating the Nation
1776 (U.S./Creating the Nation & Pennsylvania; Drama/Musicals; Char. Dev.:
Rebellion; Ethical Emphasis: Trustworthiness; Responsibility; Citizenship)
[11+]
The Birth of the Constitution (Char. Dev.: Patriotism) [9 - 12]
The Midnight Ride of Paul Revere (Literature; Char. Dev.: Patriotism;
Rebellion) [8-13]
Roots Vol. III (U.S./Diversity; Char. Dev.: Diversity) [12+]
The Smithsonian and the Presidency (U.S./1860 - 1865; and 1929 - 1941; Char.
Dev.: Patriotism) [7 - 11]

I liked The Patriot too, but follow it up with "what's true and what's not"
afterward. Mel's character was based partly on Robert Marion, the Swamp Fox.
http://www.geocities.com/BourbonStreet/1786/swampfox.html
Believe it or not, I recognized part of the story from my old Childcraft
books!

-----Original Message-----
From: Dana Matt [mailto:hoffmanwilson@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 03, 2002 11:27 AM
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Revolutionary war


The Mel Gibson one from last year....The Patriot, I
think it was called. That's a great one! ;)

(Who will learn about anything Mel Gibson wants to
teach me!)
Dana

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Revolutionary war
messages.msgSnippet: And if you re planning on attending the SC Live& Learn Unschooling conference, you ll be RIGHT smack dab in the middle of the Revolutionary War. Camden (with
messages.messageBody:
And if you're planning on attending the SC Live& Learn Unschooling
conference, you'll be RIGHT smack dab in the middle of the Revolutionary War.
Camden (with its revolutionary war parks, reinactments, museums, and stuff)
is only a 30 minute drive from my house. The character Gibson played was
loosely based on the Swamp Fox, Francis Marion---local hero. Tarleton
Bannister was housed in Camden. And the movie was filmed here. We
chocked-FULL of "colorful" characters! <g>

You know us Southerners, we like our wars!!!!

Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Revolutionary war
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/3/02 10:28:25 AM, hoffmanwilson@yahoo.com writes:  Have you seen Tim?
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/3/02 10:28:25 AM, hoffmanwilson@... writes:

<< (Who will learn about anything Mel Gibson wants to
teach me!) >>

Have you seen Tim?
It's one of his first movies. Australian. He plays an adult retarded man
who lives with his parents, and works with his dad.

It's really touching. You'll learn a lot. Very thought provoking.
And there is much of a very young Mel Gibson in shorts. Swim trunks. Work
clothes.

Sandra
